documents.title: Introduction
documents.summary: A comprehensive guide to the mitmproxy suite of tools including console, web, and command-line interfaces for intercepting and modifying HTTP/HTTPS traffic.

documents.title: Installation
documents.summary: This guide provides installation instructions for mitmproxy across macOS, Linux, and Windows, including development setup, PyPI installation, Docker images, and security considerations for binary packages.

documents.title: Getting Started
documents.summary: This guide teaches users how to install and configure mitmproxy to start intercepting and inspecting HTTP traffic, including browser setup and TLS verification steps.

documents.title: User Interface
documents.summary: This tutorial introduces the mitmproxy user interface, explaining how to navigate flows, view request and response details using keyboard shortcuts, and execute commands in the command prompt.

documents.title: Modify Requests
documents.summary: This is the official documentation website for mitmproxy, a powerful Python platform for HTTP(S) testing, security analysis, and debugging of web applications and APIs.

documents.title: User Interface
documents.summary: A comprehensive documentation site for mitmproxy, covering installation, tutorials, core concepts, API reference, and various usage guides.

documents.title: Replay Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to replay previous client requests using mitmproxy's client-side replay feature.

documents.title: Options
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's option system, describing how YAML configuration files control runtime behavior through typed values, including details on usage, editing, and available options.

documents.title: Filter expressions
documents.summary: This document explains filter expressions used in mitmproxy for filtering flows based on various criteria like URLs, headers, response codes, and content.

documents.title: mitmproxy.http
documents.summary: This document defines the Headers and MessageData classes for representing HTTP messages in the mitmproxy framework, including methods for header management and serialization.

documents.title: mitmproxy.dns
documents.summary: This document defines data classes and functions for handling DNS (Domain Name System) resource records, questions, and related types within the mitmproxy framework.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.context
documents.summary: This document defines the Context class used by mitmproxy's proxy core, which provides access to client connections, server connections, options, and protocol layer stacks for each proxy layer.

documents.title: Analyze Flows
documents.summary: Analysis of business workflows and process flows

documents.title: Intercept Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to intercept web requests in mitmproxy using flow filters to selectively pause and modify traffic.

documents.title: mitmproxy.udp
documents.summary: This document defines UDPMessage and UDPFlow classes for representing UDP datagrams and sessions in the mitmproxy framework.

documents.title: Certificates
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure mitmproxy's certificate authority for SSL/TLS interception, including automatic setup, manual installation for various platforms, and usage of custom server certificates.

documents.title: Proxy Modes
documents.summary: This guide explains the different proxy modes available in mitmproxy, including regular proxy, local capture, WireGuard, reverse proxy, transparent proxy, TUN interface, upstream proxy, SOCKS proxy, and DNS server modes.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.mode_specs
documents.summary: This module defines and parses proxy mode specifications for mitmproxy, including regular, reverse, transparent, and upstream modes with configurable listen addresses and ports.

documents.title: Features
documents.summary: This guide documents the various filtering and transformation features available in mitmproxy for controlling HTTP traffic, including request blocking, local file mapping, URL rewriting, and body modifications.

documents.title: Custom Commands
documents.summary: This document explains how to create and use custom commands in mitmproxy addons, including command declaration, typing, arguments, flow handling, and supported types.

documents.title: Protocols
documents.summary: This page documents the various web protocols supported by mitmproxy, including HTTP/1, HTTP/2, HTTP/3, WebSocket, DNS, and generic TCP/TLS and UDP/DTLS proxying, along with their known limitations.

documents.title: Transparently Proxying VMs
documents.summary: This guide explains how to set up transparent proxying with mitmproxy using VirtualBox VMs and dnsmasq for network configuration.

documents.title: Overview
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's addon mechanism and provides examples of creating custom addons using both class-based and abbreviated scripting syntax.

documents.title: What's Next
documents.summary: This document serves as a concluding section of a mitmproxy tutorial, providing information on configuring mitmproxy for browser traffic and directing users to additional resources.

documents.title: System CA on Android Emulator
documents.summary: This guide explains how to install the mitmproxy CA certificate into an Android emulator's system certificate store to enable HTTPS interception for all applications, covering prerequisites, certificate renaming, and installation methods including Magisk modules and writable-system options.

documents.title: mitmproxy.websocket
documents.summary: This module defines classes for representing WebSocket messages and WebSocket connection data in mitmproxy, where WebSocket connections are now represented as HTTP flows with a websocket attribute.

documents.title: mitmproxy.connection
documents.summary: This document defines the Connection base class and Client class used in mitmproxy to represent network connections, including TLS details and connection states.

documents.title: mitmproxy.flow
documents.summary: This document defines the Error and Flow base classes for the mitmproxy framework, representing network connections and their associated data.

documents.title: mitmproxy.net.server_spec
documents.summary: This document defines the ServerSpec type and provides a parse function to convert server specifications like URLs into structured tuples containing scheme and host/port information.

documents.title: Event Hooks
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive reference of all available event hooks in mitmproxy addons, organized by their lifecycle and connection types.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.server_hooks
documents.summary: Defines event hook data classes for tracking client and server connection lifecycle events in mitmproxy.

documents.title: Ignoring Domains
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure mitmproxy to ignore or bypass interception for specific hosts using the ignore_hosts option.

documents.title: mitmproxy.addonmanager
documents.summary: This document defines the addon manager for mitmproxy, including classes for loading, registering, and managing addons.

documents.title: mitmproxy.coretypes.multidict
documents.summary: This document defines an abstract base class and concrete implementations of a MultiDict data structure that supports multiple values per key with customizable key conversion and value reduction logic.

documents.title: Examples
documents.summary: This document provides example scripts and usage patterns for mitmproxy addons, demonstrating various use cases like request modification, command handling, streaming, and content view customization.

documents.title: Wireshark and SSL/TLS
documents.summary: This document explains how to enable SSL/TLS master key logging in mitmproxy for external packet decryption tools like Wireshark.

documents.title: Transparent Proxying
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure transparent proxying with mitmproxy on Linux, OpenBSD, and macOS using network layer redirection mechanisms.

documents.title: How mitmproxy works
documents.summary: This document explains how mitmproxy handles different proxying modes including explicit HTTP and HTTPS connections with its Man-in-the-Middle mechanism.

documents.title: mitmproxy.certs
documents.summary: Certificate management module for mitmproxy SSL/TLS interception

documents.title: Kubernetes Services
documents.summary: This document describes kubetap, a kubectl plugin that enables easy deployment of mitmproxy to proxy Kubernetes services.

documents.title: mitmproxy.tls
documents.summary: This document defines Python classes for parsing and handling TLS ClientHello messages, including extracting SNI and ALPN protocols.

documents.title: mitmproxy.tcp
documents.summary: This document defines TCPFlow and TCPMessage classes for handling TCP connections in mitmproxy, including serialization methods and flow representation.

documents.title: Commands
documents.summary: This document explains how to use commands in mitmproxy, including flow specifications, custom key bindings, and the interactive command prompt.

documents.title: Replay Flows
documents.summary: This is the main documentation navigation page for mitmproxy, a powerful HTTP/HTTPS proxy with a web interface, command-line tool, and Python API for intercepting, analyzing, and modifying web traffic.

documents.title: /howto/transparent/
documents.summary: This document provides no content for metadata extraction.

documents.title: Custom Contentviews
documents.summary: Tutorial showing how to create custom content views for an app.

documents.title: Modify Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to modify intercepted HTTP requests using mitmproxy's interactive editor.

documents.title: Client playback: a 30 second example
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to use mitmproxy's client replay feature to automate login flows by recording an HTTP conversation and replaying it without manual intervention.

documents.title: Custom Options
documents.summary: This guide explains how to create and manage addon options in mitmproxy, including declaring options with types, handling configuration updates, and validation.

documents.title: mitmproxy.contentviews
documents.summary: This document defines the Contentview protocol and provides utilities for formatting, decoding, and re-encoding data in mitmproxy.

documents.title: API Changelog
documents.summary: This document lists breaking API changes in mitmproxy across multiple versions, including logging, connection events, contentviews, and WebSocket flows.

documents.title: Intercept Traffic
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive documentation and tutorials for mitmproxy, covering installation, core concepts, API reference, addon development, and practical usage guides.

documents.title: Setting highscores on Apple GameCenter
documents.summary: Instructions for implementing highscore tracking using Apple GameCenter framework in iOS applications
